Reviews.Title: “SMALL Rooms, No Elevator”
Reviews.Author: Silverspringer1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alcyone for one night recently. The "canal" view is from the breakfast room on the ground floor, our room looked at a stucco wall only feet away. And small. There was hardly space for our luggage and us. The door did not open fully as it hit the bed at 90 degrees, and the other side of the bed was up against the wall and wardrobe. A two foot space at the foot of the bed allowed one-at-a-time navigation to the window next to the wardrobe to check out the view of the air shaft and adjacent stucco wall. The bed was pretty soft and the room overall quaint but threadbare, but the worst was that there was no elevator to the third (what we in the US would call fourth) floor. Just worn and somewhat slippery marble stairs that left us lugging our luggage up and down again. Works if you are living out of a backpack, but we were at the end of a week long cruise with two larger-than-carryon rolling bags. Location is good, but it more than the minute from Piazza San Marco that some have suggested, (at least not by any route we discovered), but is fairly close, and closer yet to the Rialto Bridge and the vaporetto and water taxi stops. While the location was good, there were plenty of options nearby, and I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kfitz1742
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed five nights at this hotel. It certainly served its purpose for a stay in Venice. Breakfast was adequate, the coffee was quite good. Biscuits, croissants, cheese, ham etc. A few cereals to choose from. The rooms were decent sized. Some posts complained about small rooms but we had no problem there-- plenty of room for one large suit case, one carry on and a back pack. Bathroom clean, water pressure good. Nice windows that opened wide. We didnt have a view from room 201 but we did get to see into a little alley way that lead to some residents homes. The room was cleaned once per day and we were given fresh towels daily. My only complaint is that the beds were HORRIBLE. They were like sleeping on the floor. Two twins pushed together so one of us was always falling in the crack. You may want to bring a foam liner as you really will want a nice night's sleep after walking around all day. I believe the hotel advertises free wifi but it is really 3euro for one hour. The reception desk was helpful and would make reservations and recommendations if requested. There was a nice sun deck on top, perfect for drinking some prosecco and relaxing after a long day of sight seeing. Any questions just ask me!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: samm4312
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Alcyone Hotel 30 December. The location was perfect, within minutes you are at San Marcs Piazza or Rialto Bridge. The staff were very helpful and the room (despite being rather small) was lovely, clean and relatively comfortable beds. We had our own bathroom and didn't find any problems with the hygiene or cleanliness. The breakfast was basic but had a variety of cereals and fruits. Wouldn't recommend for a family staying for a long time as the rooms really are small - but we would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hygiene”
Reviews.Author: JerryBr
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel for it's location which is fantastic but would never return again. While entering the bathroom it became clear that this hotel doesn't care to much about hygiene: lots of mold in the shower, fungus on the faucet, urine on the outside of the toilet (after the first cleanup, I still needed to ask the reception if they could clean the toilet on the outside), dried urine on the floor, no cover on the toilet (while the toilet in the hall has one). Because of a very poor ventilation, the bathroom started smelling so bad after one day that I had to hold my breath while going in! I don't care about sizes of a room or the quality of breakfast during a citytrip, which is ok for this 3 star hotel (nice breakfast area btw), but what I've expierenced is unacceptable!!!!! When I return to this beautifull city, I will gladly pay a little bit more!

Reviews.Title: “smallest rooms ever.”
Reviews.Author: shivanitalwar
Reviews.Content: the rooms are so small that there is barely any place to stand. there isnt enough space for 2 suitcases. we chose the hotel for its location which is superb but there are tonnes of better hotels in the same location. very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for the money”
Reviews.Author: nford333
Reviews.Content: I'm glad that we weren't swayed by the negative reviews because we were pleasantly surprised by our stay at the Hotel Alcyone when we visited in May 2009. The location is fantastic - very close to St. Mark's Square and many wonderful dining options. On top of the location, there was a free daily breakfast -- nothing over the top, but just another nice touch. I noticed that a lot of people complained about room and bathroom size, but I have to say that the room was standard-size compared to other European cities we've stayed in. The bathroom was nicely appointed and clean. This is not a five-star luxury hotel and it's unfair to rate it against those standards, but it is a nice, clean, centrally-located hotel for an exceptional value. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “So Venetian, rooms like stage sets.”
Reviews.Author: abnicho
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in all respects. By Venice standards price is good value. Book direct with hotel for best rate. Can`t understand the negative opinions expressed by some unless they prefer the blandness of cloned, multi-national sameness. This hotel is SO Venetian it is gorgeous, plus clean, friendly, helpful, safe & great location. Very good buffet breakfast with gondolas sliding past the huge picture window. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “OK at best”
Reviews.Author: Zetravler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location about a minute walk to St Marco Square etc but other than that I'd prefer to stay elsewhere. The hotel walls are super thin and this lead to very little sleep as there were people partying into the early hours on all nights, the room was very small but clean and not too shabby. So if noise, bad breakfast and small is ok for you then this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: yokothari
Reviews.Content: We booked ourselves 2 rooms through hotel website and received email confirmation as well. However, when we reached the hotel at ~10pm, we were told that there was some problem with our reservation and we would need to shift to another of their group hotel (Belle Arti) which is somewhat away from St mark's across Academia bridge. We had to walk with all our luggage to that hotel as we could not afford to search for a new hotel at that time. The staff at both hotels were very rude and behaved quite unprofessionally. We learnt later that this is a common trick used by the hotel to fill up their other hotel (far and worse). Advise not to book Alcyone at any cost.

Reviews.Title: “On balance a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: walkerbarometers
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews prior to going, we entered with some trepidation.........Entrance......a disarming mirrored corridor.....but friendly and attentive english speaking staff. Bedroom....? Well!! Tart's boudoirs - allegedly! - have nothing on this. Crimson everywhere; sumptuous tapestry "wallpaper" overpowering for me, though expense not spared. Small double; but par size for Venice........... Hotel clean and well appointed. Good location - 3 minutes walk from St. Mark's. Breakfast bar with canal view. Fare limited and mediocre quality. Coffee/rolls/cheese/ fruit juice all should have been much better.

Reviews.Title: “ok for one day only (room 207)”
Reviews.Author: chia2
Reviews.Content: * Describe the service you experienced Black haired receptionist very friendly. many receptionists dont speak english. Thank god i speak a bit of italian. I reserved the room for a wrong date but ended up changing the plans so that i dont loose the money as nobody in the hotel could tell me whether i could come earlier. * Tell us how you liked the room colors are very rich and venetian red and gold. Although blue would have been more relaxing.Shower pressure is good. * Talk about the location & amenities Location is the best as well as the price of EUR 50 per night for a double room in Feb 2010. I liked the stairway because it was done in marble and had nice lighting. Although it is kind of narrow and steep. I liked the breakfast room because it had perfectly done marble tiles and tables and the bar. And you can look at the canal while eating breakfast. it was great to have a breakfast in the price of the room of EUR 50. We could choose from coffee (nescafe) hot chocolate and tea to have it served. Self service : fruit juice (ot 100%) cheese, ham, salami, bread buns, croissant, 2 other sweet things, 3 sorts of cereal, canned fruit, butter, nutella, honey, marmelade. * I liked the least: the size of the room. the softness of the beds. I woke up all swallen in the morning and not rested at all. As if a truck ran me over. The room was too hot, although we turned of the air conditioning. it was supposably refurbished in 2009 but maybe not the bathroom which was also tiny . the part where the shower is attached was partly broken. and everything that used to look silver was worn out (tap etc). did not use the shower fully. I noticed some black spots in the edges of the shower (possibly mould) Sylicone should have been renewed. the wash basin was clogged instantly bidet tap also looked very used up and the part of the toilet you press to flush the water. As everything is covered in carpet and fabric you cannot really see whether it is dirty. What also bothered me was that the floor was uneven so one cabinet looke as if it will tip over. There is a place with 5-6 hangers to hang your clothes but no real cupboard. No place but floor to put your suitcases. No mini bar. Internet you had to pay for and it did not work even in the lobby. I would stay in this hotel for one day, not longer.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room with terrible bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Laurajw84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, just a couple of streets away from St.Mark's square but sadly this doesn't make up for the room we were given or the price charged for it. I understand that to get this kind of location in Venice you have to expect to pay a higher rate but it would also be nice to be able to sit on the toilet without your knees pushed up against the wall. The entrance hall and dining room are nicely decorated but unfortunately the room we were given was decorated in what I can only imagine is traditional Venetian style. The door would not open fully due to the wardrobe and a chair being placed in the entrance directly behind it as there was nowhere else to put them due to the room being so small. A double bed filled the majority of the room with very small bedside stands on either side. The Walls are covered in a gold and red fabric which unfortunately only made the room feel smaller. The air conditioning made a very irritating noise all the time, even when switched off and the main light in the room had four out of five lightbulbs missing and was held together by masking tape. The bathroom was so narrow we could barely move in it and the shower flooded the bathroom floor whenever it was used. The toilet was so close to the wall you could not sit straight on without your knees touching the wall and by our last day had begun to smell like a train toilet. Our room was at the front of the hotel so it was quite noisy all night which is to be expected due to it being on a main Venice street. The staff were very lacklustre and quite abrupt when we checked in and completely ignored us when we went for breakfast. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, whilst in a great location it doesn't give good value for money and I will not be returning on my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a horrible mistake”
Reviews.Author: Aziva
Reviews.Content: First of all we wanted to have a room for non-smoker...we came in and it was totally stinky after cigaretes.Room and bathroom were absolutly too small ! You cant move comfortable. Shower was dirty. I think they didnt clean it after previous guests. Under the shower was a lot of hair. We were afraid to touch what ever. On the one of the pillows was an old blood...It was really disgusting....Something about service in this hotel? I think they dont care about guests comfort. Service is rude. A specially the blond recepcionist. She wanted that we will leave the hotel as fast as possible. She didnt say ''bye'' and nothing. Its also a problem to speak with them in english. For a breakfast we got many sweet things but just a few hum and cheese, and no fruits and no vegetables. Pictures in internet dont tell a true about this hotel. So what can I say more? I would never recomend Alcyone Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Be warned - they OVERBOOK”
Reviews.Author: SidJamesUk
Reviews.Content: Despite advising the hotel of a late arrival, we were overbooked. It wasn't just us either, there were other people arriving at the same time in the same predicament. They put us in a sister hotel - the Belle Arti which was in a far less convenient location, and was terrible. The night manager was useless, as was the day manager the next morning - they were arrogant and smug, knowing that they had deliberately overbooked us in order to fill the Belle Arti. Their email confirmation for the Alcyone said " let us know if we can do anything to make your stay more comfortable" that's a joke. They didn't even offer to help us transfer to the Belle Arti, some 15 minutes away in a poor location. Smug and arrogant management - avoid all the hotels in this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Be afraid. Be very afraid.”
Reviews.Author: losttravelerTokyo
Reviews.Content: It was 2 years ago I was in Venice and now that my associate is travelling there again I am prompted to write this brief review/warning. STAY AWAY. This is hotel HELL if ever there were such a thing. 1.Smell is terrible. 2.Room is small (and I live in Japan so I am used to small rooms)3.Shower was dirty, I think, because from what I recall, I did not use it (and yes, I bather regularly).4. And to top things off there were countless bugs in varying shapes, sizes and colors crawling from a hole above my bed. This was a nightmare. Could not have been worse. So, just in case that was not clear - DO NOT STAY HERE. Please, for your own sake - stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: kats9
Reviews.Content: This without a doubt the Worst Hotel we ever stayed at. The reception staff was extremely unfriendly. The room was small, The bathroom was no larger than a closet There was a very unpleasant odor. The place was infested with bugs. We visit Venice from time to time but will never again stay at this dump.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: nickdearest
Reviews.Content: The location is superb. Very close to Rialto Bridge and not too far to walk to San Marco. It also have a direct airport shuttle boat from Rialto Pier (you have to buy the ticket on board; don't trust what it says on the sign). The area is surrounded by souvenir shops, high street brands and multi-culture food. Nevertheless, we stayed on the top floor (mind you, this hotel has no lift), and there was no heating system. It was so freezing in the room. Regardless of the heating, the room was unbelievably clean and suit the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Passable”
Reviews.Author: superheterodyne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel (booked through a French online agency) for 4 nights in August. Overall, it did give us a roof and a bed for 4 nights. The location of the hotel, of course, is hardly beatable, just minutes from St Mark square. The room was quite big, and nicely decorated. Cleanliness was just passable - the sheets and towels were not changed, although the room and the bathroom were adequately clean, but not thoroughly. Breakfast is really low-grade - I only had hot drinks there throughout the stay. The hotel is OK for a short stay in Venice, and it is decent, but absolutely no-frills.

Reviews.Title: “Death By Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: night_lamia
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself would have been acceptable for its price due to its convinient location with easy access to either the Rialto Bridge or the San Macro Square. The rooms have an antique type theme, no AC (supplied with a fan though), surprisingly clean and modern bathroom for a budget hotel. Personally I liked the washroom, however I am of a small stature and could see how anyone bigger than 110 lbs could find it a tight squeeze... Things started to go downhill after the first night when my brother complained of being bitten throughout the night. After looking through his bed, I confirmed that there were some insects crawling on the bed sheets. At first we thought they were ants that were attracted to the food we ate in the room...but after we left Venice and had access to the internet = wikipedia, we identified them as BED BUGS. This was confirmed since after a couple days we left Venice my brother's body appeared to have TONS of bites. We would have definitely complained to the hotel manager but the bites started to appear only when we got to Germany. This could be a one room thing...but this is a warning to anyone else who may be considering to stay in this hotel. Avoid this hotel if possible!! Or at least room 21!!

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Steve0762
Reviews.Content: The Alcyone is a 2* Superior rating, and just about makes the grade. It is functional, clean and welcoming, but very much no-frills. The rooms are bijou and basic, and - in our case - VERY high up (53 stairs high, actually)... but they were tidied daily, with new bedding and fresh towels, plus there's a decent enough en-suite bathroom, and you felt your property was secure there. The breakfast was standard Italian fare of toast, savories, cereals & coffee, but you could help yourself to seconds if needed. The location, however, is first class: The Alcyone sits on the Calle de Fabbri, midway between St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge, and upon leaving the hotel's doorway, you are immediately immersed in Venice's rich atmosphere of age-old architecture, canals, bridges, and some really quite wonderful shops. ...So if it's a roof over your head you're looking for at an inexpensive price, and you're not too worried about creature comforts and a "Full English" to start the day, then the Alcyone will do just fine. There are better hotels, for sure, but also a lot worse - and the staff, we found, were polite, courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing going for this hotel is location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my teenage daughter round Italy and took particular pains to ensure two beds at each pre-booked hotel. Arrived at this hotel to be told that they could not offer me a room with two beds and were totally disinterested and unapolegetic. I spent my first night in Italy on the floor at the princely sum of Euro150! Rooms were cramped but this is common in Venice - unfortunately these were not very clean, had no air conditioning and paper thin walls - so was very noisy day and night. Breakfast was very basic with just one poor lady trying to serve all the guests - typically it took more than 15 minutes for her to come by and clean the table from the previous occupant. The location is very good 1/2 way between the Rialto and St Marks - but that is really all this hotel has going for it. Staff were unfriendly and unhelpful - quick to take your money though! For me, this hotel took the fun out of Venice - I would recommend giving this a big miss. For another 30 euro a night I would stay in one of the excellent Best Westerns that I saw there.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: pinky71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March. It is very central - on one end is the Rialto Bridge and on the other side is San Marco Square. However the rooms are tiny and quite felt like Alice In Wonderland! However considering everything in Venice is expensive, this hotel was alright for the money we paid. The reception staff were friendly and helpful though the corridors was musty. For the price it was good. Do go to Venice before the crowds come in, it was nice in March but summer months must be really crowded

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: KentSusan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alcyone hotel in late May. Our room was small but clean. Breakfast was simple consisting of a roll/croissant, cereal, yoghurt, fruit juice and coffee. The breakfast room only has 7 tables and if the hotel is full you may find you have to wait for a seat. As the previous reviewer indicates the location of the hotel is excellent being within easy walking distance of both St Marks Square and the Rialto Bridge. There isn't a lift but this shouldn't be a problem if you're fit and pack light. Taking into account price and location I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “cant go wrong”
Reviews.Author: bankrupt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brilliant position being near to St.Marks Square and the Realto bridge. if any one is thinking of a weekend break in venice look no further and book here. i gave it a good rating because it is the best 2star accom i have stayed in. after reading the reveiws about room sizes i was worried about opening the door! i was amazed at the actual size and can only imagine everyone giving reveiws on this hotel live in mansions! we thought the room was more than adequate and actually quite liked it. it is only for sleeping in after all. Breakfast was ok and filled a gap. the best thing is LOCATION,LOCATION,LOCATION!

Reviews.Title: “Budget but amazing location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just to say that we have recently returned from a week in Venice staying at the 2* Hotel Alcyone (booked via Hotelconnect) and if you want a budget hotel right in the heart of Venice, this is certainly one to consider. Some of the rooms are exceedingly small but if you choose rooms to the left of the stairs, they seemed to be much bigger. (We had to change rooms due to a water leak in the bathroom but there was no fuss in doing this and as a result we had a better room). The en suite bathrooms are interesting in that you can only walk along them sideways but if you are prepared to put up with a little less than luxury this hotel is right in the heart of the St Marks district, only 5 minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge and 5 minutes from St Marks Square. The breakfast room is also quite small and only caters for 2 per table so not very sociable for families but the breakfast of croissants, rolls, cereals, yogurts and various drinks was absolutely fine. There is no air conditioning but as the hotel is situated in a very old narrow street, the sun does not seem to penetrate the building and it was quite bearable, even in July. Please note: Venice does NOT smell at this time of year. We had the most wonderful holiday and the fact that you can get backwards and forwards to your hotel so easily is a huge bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: fastturtle
Reviews.Content: The Alcyone turned out to be just what we expected. The rooms are on the small side but clean and furnished nicely and the bathroom is fine. Only down side was that our room, like others, looked onto a building undergoing renovation work and was a 4th floor walk up. (But you only have to carry your suitcases up once and after walking around Rome and Florence a few flights of stairs were nothing.) I agree with the review that gave the hotel a five star rating for location and it was great. Yes, you may pay extra for location but is it worth it! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not much else”
Reviews.Author: Tucci
Reviews.Content: Granted the hotel is a 2 star. Pros: Location Cons: Stairs only an issue if you are on the 4th floor. Extremely small room even by European standards-two people trying to move around was a chore. The bathroom was even smaller-couldn't sit on the loo without hitting your head on the window/wall opposite it. Mold in the corners of the shower. Paper-thin walls (luckily our neighbors were quiet). We killed 4 mosquitoes one night (the fifth one was elusive thus lived). We wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small But Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was great, the staff were friendly and it was clean. Everything we need when the room is just for sleeping in!! The hotel was what we expected for a 2 star in Italy. Yes the room was small and we had to climb 2 flights of stairs to get to it. The room may have been small, but the bed was a large double and more importantly the sheets were clean. The bathroom was small (I could almost have a shower while on the toilet), but again it was clean AND we got new towels each day. The breakfast was an Italian basic - croissant,rolls and coffee. If you were still peckish there's plenty of cafes and bakeries nearby.

HotelInfo.Name: Alcyone Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco Calle Dei Fabbri 4712, 30124 Venice, Italy
